description: A risk manager requests a cross‑reference compliance training module that aligns the HIPAA Privacy Rule with the company's internal health‑data policy, and the CompliLearn Builder agent fetches both documents, extracts obligations, creates a comparative table, generates a quiz, renders an interactive SCORM package, stores it in the LMS and returns the module link.

messages.content: You are CompliLearn Builder, an AI‑driven compliance‑training platform. You can fetch regulatory texts, extract key concepts, generate quizzes, render interactive learning modules, store them in the corporate LMS and retrieve analytics. Respond in a helpful, step‑by‑step manner, invoking tools when needed.

Hi, I need a training module that cross‑references the HIPAA Privacy Rule with our internal health‑data policy (Policy‑HealthData‑2023). It should show a side‑by‑side table of obligations, explain the differences, and include a short quiz for employees.

Sure, I’ll build that for you. First I’ll retrieve the full text of the HIPAA Privacy Rule and your internal policy, then extract the key obligations from each, create a comparative table, generate a quiz, render the interactive module and store it in the LMS.

Full text of HIPAA Privacy Rule (2022 revision):

1. Covered Entities must implement safeguards to protect PHI.
2. Minimum Necessary standard applies to disclosures.
3. Individuals have right to access their PHI.
4. Required breach notification within 60 days.
5. Authorization required for most non‑treatment disclosures.
...

Internal Health‑Data Policy (Policy‑HealthData‑2023):

A. All employee‑handled health data must be encrypted at rest and in transit.
B. Access limited to role‑based permissions; only care team members may view PHI.
C. Data retention period is 7 years.
D. Quarterly privacy training mandatory for all staff.
E. Incident reporting to Security Office within 48 hours of detection.
...
I have the two documents. Next, I’ll extract the key obligations and concepts from each.

concepts.description: Covered Entities must implement administrative, physical, and technical safeguards to protect PHI.
All health data must be encrypted at rest and in transit.
Only the minimum necessary PHI may be disclosed for a given purpose.
Access to PHI is limited to care‑team members based on job role.
Covered Entities must notify affected individuals within 60 days of a breach.
Security Office must be notified within 48 hours of any data incident.
Individuals have the right to access and obtain a copy of their PHI.
Health data must be retained for seven years.
Prior authorization is required for most non‑treatment disclosures of PHI.
All staff must complete privacy training each quarter.

arguments.title: HIPAA Privacy Rule vs. Internal Health‑Data Policy – Cross‑Reference Training

sections.heading: Overview
sections.body: This module compares key obligations from the HIPAA Privacy Rule with our Internal Health‑Data Policy (2023). Understanding the overlap helps ensure we meet both regulatory and corporate requirements.

sections.heading: Comparative Obligations Table
sections.body:
ObligationHIPAA Privacy RuleInternal Policy
Safeguards / EncryptionAdministrative, physical, and technical safeguards required.All health data must be encrypted at rest and in transit.
Access ControlsMinimum Necessary principle.Role‑based access limited to care‑team members.
Breach / Incident ReportingNotify individuals within 60 days.Report to Security Office within 48 hours.
Data RetentionNot explicitly specified in Privacy Rule.Retain health data for 7 years.
TrainingRequires workforce training on privacy.Quarterly privacy training mandatory.
